speaker: narrator
dialog: Sitting down you decide to rest your eyes for a second and recount what has led up to this moment.

speaker: narrator
dialog: First off, what is your name?

speaker: narrator
dialog: You are a new student at the esteemed Royal Academy, with today being the first day at the school year. Aside from the hectic move in day your time at the school has been largely uneventful.

speaker: narrator
dialog: Until...

speaker: claire
dialog: Open your eyes at once! That is not funny at all!

speaker: claire
dialog: Excuse me! Are you listening?

speaker: claire
dialog: A mere commoner has the nerve to share a desk with me? Know your place!

speaker: narrator
dialog: Claire François, your apparent seat neighbor. Noble Daughter to the François house.

speaker: claire
dialog: I will not stand for this. I order you to move at once!

speaker: narrator
dialog: Even if you wanted to, the seats are assigned. Both for organization and so student won't try to sit next to each other to disrupt the class.

speaker: claire
dialog: Well?

speaker: claire
dialog: At least you know your place. However I refuse to share with a simple commoner for more than a day. By tommorrow you will be transferred.

speaker: claire
dialog: ExCUSE ME? How dare a commoner order ME around?

speaker: claire
dialog: This is unacceptable, I will not share a desk with a commoner.

speaker: narrator
dialog: Before Claire can say anything else the strike of the clock signals the start of class. Claire begrudgingly takes her seat.

speaker: narrator
dialog: Sitting next to a commoner is far more dignified than causing a ruckus on the first day.

speaker: teacher
dialog: Good morning class! I am pleased to welcome on your first official day here at the Royal Academy!

speaker: teacher
dialog: My name is Professor Magic I will be your homeroom teacher for this year. First I will go over how your daily schedules will work.

speaker: teacher
dialog: You will have 2 classes everyday separated by a break in between in the Afternoon, save for any special events we may have that day.

speaker: teacher
dialog: Aside from those two classes you will have your Mornings before class and Evenings after class free.

speaker: teacher
dialog: Curfew is 10pm on Weekdays and 12am on Weekends so please be back in your dorms by that time.

speaker: teacher
dialog: For this week we will be gauging you all on your knowledge culminating into an exam on Day 1 of next week.

speaker: teacher
dialog: With that, let us start class.
